name: Mango-Banana Bread
author: sara therese
summary: My Hawaiian family got me every type of fruit bread you can think of while I was in Maui. I fell in love with all of them, and now that summer is here I decided to take a shot at this bread recipe. So here is my first attempt at mango- banana bread!
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Take about 1/4 of the chopped mango and puree in a food processor or blender until it is the same consistency as mashed bananas; it should yield about 1/2 cup pureed mango
Sift flour, baking soda, cinnamon, salt, and pumpkin pie spice together in a large bowl
Combine butter, white sugar, and brown sugar in a small bowl until blended; mix in eggs and vanilla extract
Fold into the dry ingredients until just combined
Fold in chopped mango, pureed mango, banana, coconut, and walnuts
Pour into the prepared loaf pan
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 55 to 65 minutes
